alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Somerset and east central Franklin Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Kingfield, or 20 miles east of Eustis, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingfield, Bingham, Carrabassett Valley, Phillips, Embden, Avon, Caratunk Plantation, Dead River, Carrying Place, Bigelow, Moscow, Lexington, Mount Abram, Highland Plantation, Salem, Wyman, Pierce Pond, Johnson Mountain, West Fork Plantation and Concord. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Southern Somerset
